sen.j: 袖岡 文景（そでおか ふみかげ、寛政11年7月28日 (旧暦)（1799年8月28日）－安政2年6月23日 (旧暦)（1855年8月5日））は、江戸時代後期の地下家官人。
sen.e: Fumikage SODEOKA (August 28, 1799 - August 5, 1855) was a courtier of "jige-ke" (the house of lower- ranked courtiers who were not allowed to enter the court).
Fumikage SODEOKA (August 28, 1799 - August 5, 1855) was a courtier of Jige-ke (the house of lower- ranked courtiers who were not allowed to enter the court) in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: ダブルクオテーションを削除しました。訳抜け：江戸時代後期の
sen.e: Fumikage SODEOKA (August 28, 1799 - August 5, 1855) was a courtier of Jige-ke (the house of lower- ranked courtiers who were not allowed to enter the court) in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He was originally of the Tachibana clan.
His original main name was TACHIBANA.
sen.cmt: 橘氏とありますが、他のファイルと書き方を合わせました。
sen.e: His original main name was TACHIBANA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 袖岡和景の子、袖岡景命の父。
sen.e: He was the son of Kazukage SODEOKA and the father of Kagenobu SODEOKA.
sen.cmt: 「和景」「景命」の読みは仮りのものです。
sen.e: He was a son of Kazukage SODEOKA and the father of Kagenori SODEOKA.
sen.cmt: 袖岡家、橘家から読みを確認することはできませんでしたが、同じ漢字で別人物の読みを確認しました。和景：かずかげ景命：かげのり
sen.e: He was a son of Kazukage SODEOKA and the father of Kagenori SODEOKA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文化 (日本)2年に父の死により家督を継ぐ。
sen.e: He succeeded to his father who died in 1805.
He succeeded to the family head as his father died in 1805.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: He succeeded to the family head as his father died in 1805.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文化5年5月27日に正六位下釆女佑に任ぜられる。
sen.e: On June 20, 1808 he was granted the rank of Unemenosuke, Senior Sixth Lower Grade.
On June 20, 1808 he was appointed to Shorokuinoge Unemenosuke (Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade, Secretary of the division of the ancient court hostess).
sen.cmt: 釆女佑の定訳不明ですが、下記を参照して佑はSecretaryとしています。http://www.albany.edu/eas/205/rank%20chart.htm
sen.e: On June 20, 1808 he was appointed to Shorokuinoge Unemenosuke (Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade, Secretary of the division of the ancient court hostess).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同13年1月18日に従五位下玄蕃助に任ぜられる。
sen.e: On February 15, 1816 he was granted the rank of Genbanosuke, Junior Fifth Lower Grade.
On February 15, 1816 he was appointed to Jugoinoge Genbanosuke (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade, assistant director of Ministry of Buddhism and Foreign Affairs).
sen.cmt: 玄蕃助は定訳不明のため下記サイトを参照し、寺院僧尼の名簿関係・外国使節の接待・法会の管理する省の次官と解釈し、官位の補足説明に追記しました。http://homepage1.nifty.com/kitabatake/kani23.html
sen.e: On February 15, 1816 he was appointed to Jugoinoge Genbanosuke (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade, assistant director of Ministry of Buddhism and Foreign Affairs).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文政7年1月20日に従五位上に叙され、天保3年1月27日に正五位下（玄蕃助）に叙されてこれが極官となる。
sen.e: On February 19, 1824 he was granted the rank of Junior Fifth Upper Grade and on February 28, 1832 he was promoted to the rank of Senior Fifth Lower Grade (Genbanosuke), which is the highest rank he ever achieved.
On February 19, 1824 he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and on February 28, 1832 to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) which was the highest rank he ever achieved.
sen.cmt: 官位の表記を用語統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: On February 19, 1824 he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and on February 28, 1832 to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) which was the highest rank he ever achieved.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 蔵人所衆・上南座に属する地下官人であると同時に勧修寺家の家司として台所役などを務めた。
sen.e: While being a jige official among the attendants of the Kurodo-dokoro (the Imperial Secretariat) and belonged to "kaminouza," he worked in the kitchen of the Kajuji family as a domestic.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 上南座の意味不明です。読み方は下南座（しもののうざ）を参考にしました。下南座は儀式のときに役割をさすようです。
sen.e: While working as a Jige official of Kurodo tokoro no shu (officials of the Court) and Kaminouza, he served as a kitchen staff for the Kajuji family.
sen.cmt: 蔵人所衆の定訳がWebの用語集にあったため、差し替えました。台所役の定訳不明のため、kitchen staff としました。
sen.e: While working as a Jige official of Kurodo tokoro no shu (officials of the Court) and Kaminouza, he served as a kitchen staff for the Kajuji family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天保10年（1839年）より雑掌（家令）を務めて家政にあたり、勧修寺経理の教育係を務めた。
sen.e: From 1839 he became a butler (zassho or karei) in charge of domestic affairs, working as an accounting instructor at Kaju-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From 1839, he became a Zassho (or Karei: butler) and was in charge of domestic affairs, and he also served as a private tutor for Tsuneosa KASHUJI.
sen.cmt: 勧修寺経理は「かしゅうじ つねおさ」であると思われるため、英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: From 1839, he became a Zassho (or Karei: butler) and was in charge of domestic affairs, and he also served as a private tutor for Tsuneosa KASHUJI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文景の日記は『山城国京都袖岡玄蕃助家記』（三井文庫旧蔵・国文学研究資料館所蔵）として計6年分が現存している。
sen.e: Of Fumikage's dairy entitled "Yamashiro no Kuni Kyoto Sodeoka Genbanosuke Kaki" (The Family Chronicle of Genbanosuke Sodeoka in Kyoto, Yamashiro Province) (formerly owned by the Mitsui Bunko and currently housed in the National Institute of Japanese Literature), portions worth a total of six years still remain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Fumikage left a dairy called "Yamashiro no Kuni Kyoto SODEOKA Genbanosuke Kaki" (The Family Chronicle of Genbanosuke SODEOKA in Kyoto, Yamashiro Province) (formerly owned by the Mitsui Bunko and currently housed in the National Institute of Japanese Literature), and the extant portions cover six years in total.
sen.cmt: 英を書き換えました。
sen.e: Fumikage left a dairy called "Yamashiro no Kuni Kyoto SODEOKA Genbanosuke Kaki" (The Family Chronicle of Genbanosuke SODEOKA in Kyoto, Yamashiro Province) (formerly owned by the Mitsui Bunko and currently housed in the National Institute of Japanese Literature), and the extant portions cover six years in total.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 江戸時代の地下官人（下級公家）の活動及び堂上家の経営についてを知る史料となっている。
sen.e: They provide valuable information on the life of jige officials (low-ranked courtiers) as well as the management of "tosho-ke" (the house of upper court nobles) in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The diary provides valuable information on the life of Jige officials as well as the management of the Tosho-ke (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks) in the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 堂上家の定訳がWebの用語集にありましたので差し替えました。
sen.e: The diary provides valuable information on the life of Jige officials as well as the management of the Tosho-ke (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks) in the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
